keyMoments.title: Brook Officially Joins the Straw Hat Pirates
keyMoments.description: After reflecting on his 50 years of loneliness since the death of his Rumbar Pirates crew, Brook formally asks Luffy if his invitation to join the Straw Hats still stands. Luffy immediately accepts, and the crew celebrates.
keyMoments.significance: Brook becomes the ninth member of the Straw Hat Pirates and fulfills the role of musician that the crew has sought since the beginning.
keyMoments.quote: Captain Luffy... would you still allow me to join your crew?

keyMoments.title: Brook's Former Bounty Revealed
keyMoments.description: The crew learns that Brook had a bounty of 33 million Berries when he was alive, earning him the epithet 'Dead Bones' Brook the Humming Swordsman.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Brook's credibility as a former pirate and provides insight into his past reputation.

keyMoments.title: Memorial for Rumbar Pirates
keyMoments.description: Brook mourns at the grave built by Usopp and Franky for his fallen Rumbar Pirates crew, joined by Zoro in paying respects.
keyMoments.significance: Provides closure for Brook's tragic past and shows his integration into the Straw Hat family while honoring his former crew.

keyMoments.title: Brook's Eyecatcher Debuts
keyMoments.description: Brook's unique eyecatcher appears for the first time, officially marking his status as a Straw Hat crew member in the anime's visual format.
keyMoments.significance: A traditional marker of crew membership in the One Piece anime.

bounties.reason: Former bounty from 50 years ago when Brook was alive

relationships.description: Brook officially becomes Luffy's crew member, pledging his loyalty as the Straw Hats' musician.

evolutionMoments.description: Brook formally asks to join and Luffy accepts him into the crew.

relationships.description: Zoro shows solidarity with Brook by planting his broken sword at the Rumbar Pirates memorial.

evolutionMoments.description: Zoro joins Brook in mourning the Rumbar Pirates and plants Yubashiri at their grave.

reveals.information: Former bounty of 33 million Berries as 'Dead Bones' Brook
Officially joins the Straw Hat Pirates as their musician

name.japanese: シャーロット・ローラ

keyMoments.title: Lola Gives Nami Her Mother's Vivre Card
keyMoments.description: Lola gives Nami a Vivre Card pointing to her mother in the New World, believing she will help the Straw Hats if needed.
keyMoments.significance: This Vivre Card later becomes crucial in the Whole Cake Island arc. Lola's mother is revealed to be Big Mom, one of the Four Emperors.
keyMoments.quote: This Vivre Card will allow you to meet the one who has it, no matter where in the world they are.

keyMoments.title: Explains Vivre Card Mechanics
keyMoments.description: Lola teaches the Straw Hats how Vivre Cards work: they're made from fingernails, point to their owner, and shrink when the person's life force weakens.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces one of the most important navigational tools in One Piece that becomes crucial for future arcs.

relationships.description: Lola befriends Nami and entrusts her with her mother's Vivre Card.

evolutionMoments.description: Lola gives Nami her mother's Vivre Card as a token of friendship and potential future aid.

relationships.description: Lola is the daughter of Charlotte Linlin (Big Mom), though she fled an arranged marriage.

evolutionMoments.description: Lola mentions her mother is a powerful pirate in the New World and gives Nami her Vivre Card.

reveals.information: Has a mother who is a powerful pirate in the New World (later revealed to be Big Mom)

keyMoments.title: Zoro Plants Yubashiri at the Grave
keyMoments.description: Zoro plants his broken sword Yubashiri at the Rumbar Pirates' memorial grave as a tribute, showing respect for the fallen and solidarity with Brook.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Zoro's deep respect for his weapons and his empathy for Brook's loss. Marks the final farewell to Yubashiri.

keyMoments.title: Zoro's Updated Eyecatcher with Shusui
keyMoments.description: Zoro's eyecatcher is updated to feature Shusui instead of the destroyed Yubashiri.
keyMoments.significance: Visually confirms Zoro's permanent adoption of Shusui as one of his three swords.

relationships.description: Zoro shows solidarity with Brook by honoring the Rumbar Pirates.

evolutionMoments.description: Zoro plants his broken sword Yubashiri at the Rumbar Pirates' grave alongside Brook.

name.japanese: ポートガス・D・エース

keyMoments.title: Ace's Vivre Card is Burning
keyMoments.description: Ace's Vivre Card is shown to be burning and shrinking, indicating his life is in grave danger.
keyMoments.significance: Critical foreshadowing of Ace's capture and the events leading to Marineford. This moment begins the countdown to one of the series' most tragic arcs.

relationships.description: Ace is Luffy's older brother. Despite Ace being in danger, Luffy trusts him to handle his own problems.

evolutionMoments.description: Luffy decides not to rescue Ace despite his burning Vivre Card, trusting in Ace's strength and pride.

reveals.information: Ace is in mortal danger as shown by his burning Vivre Card
